intro: Dianthus giganteus subsp. italicus, commonly known as the Italian carnation, is a flowering plant characterized by its showy, clustered blooms. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is native to the Mediterranean region. The plant features upright, branching stems with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are typically pink to red, with five petals and prominent white veins. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and landscapes.
